Info.Description: Illuminates the edges in the image, creating a neon-like glow that makes the outlines stand out. It's a great tool for creating artistic effects or emphasizing particular features in the image.

Properties.Name: Edge Width
Properties.Summary: This adjusts the thickness of the glowing edges. A higher value will result in thicker, more prominent glowing lines, while a lower value will produce thinner, subtler glows.

Properties.Name: Intensity
Properties.Summary: Determines the intensity of the glow. A higher power value intensifies the brightness and saturation of the glow, while a lower power value creates a more subdued glow.

Properties.Name: Brightness
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the overall brightness of the glowing edges. Higher values will make the glow more vibrant, while lower values will produce a dimmer glow.

Properties.Name: Smoothness
Properties.Summary: Adjusts how much the glowing edges blend with the surrounding pixels. A higher smoothness value results in softer, smoother glows that blend more with the image, while a lower smoothness value produces sharper, more distinct glowing edges.

Properties.Name: Monochrome
Properties.Summary:
Applies the Glowing Edge filter only to the luminance of the image, resulting in a monochromatic output.
If disabled, the filter is applied to each color channel, preserving the original colors while still emphasizing the glowing edges.
